item.title: PhISM Percussion Synth
item.description: Background Link to heading For my ‘New Interfaces of Musical Expression’ (NIME) course we have to do a mini project where we build an instrument. We had to hand in a one-pager containing our initial first sketch and answers to some guiding quetions. My one-pager can be seen in this PDF document. One of my supervisors had already build something similar before, and suggested I looked at the article Physically Informed Sonic Modeling (PhISM): Synthesis of Percussive Sounds by Perry Cook from 1997.
